data.title: A must when in town!
data.text: I travel to Elgin once a month for work and like all places I travel to I seek out the best local restaurants. Thai is one of favorite foods and Toom Toom Thai is in the top three restaurants for Thai. Every time I'm in town I make it a point to have lunch here at least once.

data.title: Great food, but the service has been better.
data.text: The selection of food here is very good, and I've like everything I've ever had. I've been there several times and always had wonderful service. The last time though, the waiter barely paid attention to us, brought out the wrong food, and was almost rude. I'll still go back, as that has never happened before. Everybody has an off night.

data.title: Good food but slow
data.text: The food here is excellent, but the night we went we were with a very large party and it was difficult for the kitchen to get our food out all at the same time.  I'd like to go back again sometime with a smaller party.  I'm sure it would be easier for them and nicer for us.

data.title: 🙌 YUM!
data.text: I picked up Friday night takeout for the family and was very impressed with their friendliness, great customer service, and amazing food! We had the ginger shrimp, Bangkok curry noodles with tofu, sesame chicken, and pineapple fried rice. I really wish I had leftovers for breakfast! I think I might have to go back for lunch...

data.title: tasty fresh cuisine, wonderful staff
data.text: We arrived late, shortly before it was set to close, but they didn't skip a beat, welcomed us in the most friendly way, and served us deliciously prepared Thai cuisine. The food was incredibly tasty and clearly was prepared with fresh ingredients with great care. Highly recommended.

data.title: Pretty Good, but....
data.text:
Our group ate here at the recommendation of a local who swears by this place. We had a large group and were not in a hurry. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful if not exceptionally fast. I didn't feel like we waited an interminably long time but we were not pressed for time either.

I got the Masaman and ordered it medium (they offered mild, medium, and hot). It was very good but had almost no spice at all. It was mild even on the white people scale. The appetizers we ordered were very tasty but they were very light portions, barely enough to share around. 

I would recommend Toom Toom but with reservations. It certainly wasn't bad but it wasn't the best Thai food ever either.

data.title: Ok, not sure what the hype is
data.text: We went because of the rave reviews. I left disappointed honestly. Food was ok. Service was ok. Frustrating moment that clouded the rest of the visit- we asked the waitress what was always a favorite as we have never been there. Was told standard "all is good here" answer. Asked seriously what is your top ordered item. Again we got the "it is all good" response. We didn't even ask about the whole menu, just the one section.

data.title: Best Thai Food Ever
data.text: Have eaten at this restaurant twice. The food was incredibly delicious and very authentic. The Thai green curry is outstanding as well as the Pud Si Ew noodle dish. I lived in Thailand for 10 years . I was very impressed with how authentic the food tasted and was presented.  The owner is cheerful friendly and loves what she's doing.

data.title: EGG ROLLS
data.text: This is a quaint family owned restaurant that offers authentic thai food! We have been several times and are always satisfied with the dish we try!

data.title: Terrible Service and Insipid food
data.text: I attempted to dine here recently while in town for the Elgin Fringe Festival. When I arrived the place was mostly empty, except around the bar area where it seemed that alot of either family or friends where actively engaged in conversation. I was promptly seated in the dining room next door, and the completely forgotten about. After 30 minutes I went looking for my waiter, who tried to make up a story about another waiter, although he was clearly the only one waiting on tables. I then placed a simple order for Summer Rolls, Thai Coffee, and Sticky Rice with Mango. The Summer rolls were served with no sauces what-so-ever, and a bent up fork to eat them with. After waiting another 10minute I once again set out in search of my waiter to ask fro soy sauce and chop-sticks. I would have forgiven all of this had the summer rolls simply been OK. However, the slices of greens in the rolls were discolored and limp, and the rolls themselves appeared to have been wrapped by a 2 year old.

data.title: Best Thai Restaurant around
data.text: Love coming to Toom Toom!  The food is always fresh and delicious.  The service is excellent.  This is a true family run restaurant.  Mama Toom does all the cooking and her daughter takes care of the customers.  Not sure how they do it when it is busy.  But we have always had great service and wonderful food.  Love all the curry dishes, soups, and our favorite are the pot stickers - best we have ever had anywhere.

data.title: For best experience, order carry out an hour ahead or eat in during an off peak time
data.text:
I am a resident of Elgin and I love supporting the local restaurants.  Toom Toom is run by a wonderful Thai women (Mama Toom) and her daughter (Tik Tik).  The food is delicious (specifically crab fried rice and chicken rice soup).

But I have witnessed (and read here) people being dissatisfied by the service experience so I hope I can help you set expectations to avoid a negative experience.

For carry out, I will call in my order an hour before I want to pick it up to give them ample time to have it ready when I arrive.  And when I eat in, I either choose an off time (early) or I accept it will be a leisurely meal that may take a while.

With the restaurant being a small family affair, sometimes it is quite busy and they may be backlogged on the meals.

Keep this in mind if you have a specific deadline by which you need to finish your meal (i.e. theater etc.)

data.title: Good food to go
data.text:
I order food from Toom Toom frequently. I stay with the favorite Thai traditional dishes and have never had a problem. They have really flavorful sauces and I am always pleased with the food. I always know exactly what I'm getting when I eat here.

The average ranking comes with the diving in experience. A friend and I went for dinner and waited so long for food. I don't know if it was because it was a Saturday night or there were other tables, but we really thought we were forgotten about. But when the food came, we were very pleased. I felt bad for the server as it seemed like she was the only one working. But go when you have time, not when you're in a rush. 

All in all, the food is good Thai food that will fulfill your Thai cravings. Enjoy!

data.title: Worst experience ever
data.text: I've never been in a restaurant with such an UNPROFESSIONAL and RUDE customer service. The food I ordered was awful and I was literally screamed at because I complained about it. Worst restaurant experience ever. NEVER will go back there again.

data.title: Service, Taste and Good Value
data.text: I arranged a business meal for 8 from another state. Toom Toom, the chef here, was very helpful. She let me call my order in early, before they opened, so it would be ready in time. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered. The Pad Thai was especially delicious. Their summer roll in rice paper was really interesting and fresh.  And you can order at whatever level of spicy you prefer. As someone who doesn't appreciate hot and spicy, I especially liked that feature. I could have what I wanted at the hotness level I could stand. And she even threw in a free egg roll for everyone.

data.title: Thai dishes made with love - order ahead of special tasting
data.text: I usually order ahead and pickup the order or when we want to celebrate a special occasion we will reserve a space ahead of time and give Mama Toom the parameters (food allergies, protein preferences, number of people).  Our favorite is the green papaya salad (for this you should call in advance as she makes it special)

data.title: Very good Thai and better service
data.text: Had a great dinner with a lot of spice at Toom Toom.  The server is the daughter of the owner/chef and is very nice.  She suggested the a special desert that was purple rice with banana pudding.  Recommend this restaurant when in Elgin on a cold winter night.

data.title: Good Effort
data.text: The only way to describe our experience at Toom Toom was unmemorable. When we arrived our first view was the bar. It was cluttered with junk. The hostess ushered us into the dining room which had the ambiance of an opium den. She informed us that they don't have a liquor license so my wife and I had hot tea, which was a good idea because it was just slightly cooler than a meat locker. We ordered the spring rolls, they were so good that we asked for another order. Then we had the pad Thai noodles with chicken. I wanted mine spicy and my wife had them milder. The portion was generous and they were quite good. This place has the hard half of being a good place to eat covered; the food. They need to work on their decor.

data.title: Just average and barely 3 stars
data.text: This restaurant has potential, but ..there are some cons.Firstly, they have no liquor license and i like a glass of white wine with my Thai food. The vegetable egg rolls were good, but tiny and the dipping sauce was less than a skimpy portion. My husband and i both ordered pad thai with chicken. It was good, but not memorable. I like mine served with some lime on the side. This was not presented that way. Aside from that the restaurant was freezing...A/C cranked up way too high for October. People including me were eating with jackets on. We finally asked if they could turn the temp up, and the hostess did, but by the time it got warmer we were ready to go. This is a small restaurant and service tends to be slow. As an aside tables are close and the diners at the table next to us all worked in the medical field. Their conversation was impossible to avoid and they were retelling guesome medical procedures they had witnessed, including talk of needles, veins, vomit, breach births and on and on. I mean really? This went on the entire dinner. This is not dinner conversation in a tiny space when others can't help but hear you. I know this is not managements fault, but it didn't make for a pleasant meal for nearby patrons. Overall, doubtful we will return.

data.title: Where's the bell peppers?
data.text: Have eaten at this restaurant in the past and it has been pretty good.  Ate there last evening and was highly disappointed...Portion size for price especially for appetizers was poor.  Vegetable mix was odd-couldn't even offer green or red bell peppers-only banana peppers.  The standard mix is cabbage, carrot, pea pods, thin sliced zucchini (took a while to figure this out) and a little bit of broccoli.  This seemed to be in every dish.  No onions or peppers.  Ordered a dish with tofu and there was no tofu in it, so basically they took some pre-cooked tofu from an appetizer and brought it to the table to add to the dish.   So despite decent meals in the past, they seem to have gone downhill-bummer, we love Thai food!
